name: HD 30562
scenarioDescription:
The HD 30562 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 30562 is a star with 1.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.61 times its radius. It is located 85.39 light years away from the solar system.

HD 30562 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 30562 system


HD 30562 b

HD 30562 b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.34 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 30562 b is 387.96 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 30562 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 30562, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
